title: Bon AppĂŠtit tried to introduce the world to ‘hand salad’ and people aren’t having it
text:
(Picture: Getty) Today in people doing truly appalling things to do the very concept of food, meet ‘hand salad’.
‘Hand salad’ is a new dining experience created by Bon AppĂŠtit.
They tried to subtly introduce it to the world yesterday, with a tweet telling people: ‘It’s called a “hand salad” but let’s not focus on that.’
You can now get vegan afternoon tea at The Egerton House Hotel in Knightsbridge To which we say: seriously? You think we’re not going to focus on the name ‘HAND. SALAD’?
Hand Salad, to be clear, is salad that you eat with your hands like a ravenous beast forced to eat lettuce instead of carbs.
But it’s not even a proper salad, with different types of vegetables and deliciousness.
It’s literally just romaine f***ing lettuce leaves and a fancy dip.
It's called a "hand salad" but let's not focus on that https://t.co/fRTxgR79cY pic.twitter.com/XWY0mbAqF4 
— Bon AppĂŠtit (@bonappetit) March 27, 2017 

That’s it. It’s not even crudites and dip. Just sad, lonely lettuce you must dunk into dip.
Bon AppĂŠtit describe ‘hand salad’ as an appetiser for a dinner party.
Bon AppĂŠtit are out of their f***ing minds.
If I arrived at someone’s house hungry and awaiting delicious food, and they presented me with leaves and sauce, I would leave, order some spaghetti to my house, and never return to that person’s home again.
Clearly, I am not alone in this intense feeling of rage and disgust, because Bon AppĂŠtit’s tweets about ‘hand salad’ have been mercilessly mocked.

Now, if you’ll excuse us, we’re off to eat some hand bolognese (that’s cooked spaghetti dipped in sauce), hand tacos (taco fillings carried in a closed fist), and perhaps some hand hot chocolate (milk and chocolate in cupped hands, naturally).
Enjoy your dinner party, Bon AppĂŠtit. Expect to lose all friends as a result.
